data.title: Running docker in the background gives "Attribute 'program' does not exist ('path')" when clicking launcher
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run docker in the background (doesn't need to use the project I use VSCode)
2. Click the launcher button
   Error: Attribute 'program' does not exist ('path')

This error doesn't happen when I am not running docker in the background

Please fix this problem. It's blocking me from developing effectively.

data.title: Intellisense problems when project on network drive
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Win 7

When using a file on a Windows network drive, a lot of the Intellisense features are not working. Where I am at least feeling the most pain points is in using import/export ES6 statements, such that I am not able to see the components of my imported class. Peek/Find All References/Go to Definition, etc will not work.

On a desktop, this is fine. I remember Atom had this problem early on as well. A few are still open: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/1766

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Put files on network drive
2. Try to use ES6 import/export statements; Peek feature; 'Go to Definition' feature

data.title: Input box: inherit font from workbench and do not set it
data.body:
It looks like the input box is setting the font that is already defined in the workbench: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/browser/ui/inputbox/inputBox.css#L21

We should clean this up and have only one place where the font is defined (workbench) so that we a) do not have to repeat all the rules for other languages and b) make it easier to provide an option to configure the font used in VS Code.

data.title: Parameter hints: inherit font from workbench and do not set it
data.body:
It looks like the parameter hints is setting the font that is already defined in the workbench: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/editor/contrib/parameterHints/browser/parameterHints.css#L111

We should clean this up and have only one place where the font is defined (workbench) so that we a) do not have to repeat all the rules for other languages and b) make it easier to provide an option to configure the font used in VS Code.

data.title: Quick fix: inherit font from workbench and do not set it
data.body:
It looks like the quick fix widget is setting the font that is already defined in the workbench: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/editor/contrib/quickFix/browser/quickFix.css#L95

We should clean this up and have only one place where the font is defined (workbench) so that we a) do not have to repeat all the rules for other languages and b) make it easier to provide an option to configure the font used in VS Code.

data.title: VS Code crashes when left running for several days
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open two or more separate VSCode windows.
2. In each window, open a different project.
3. Leave running for several days.

**Actual:**
A message box pops up in one of the windows reporting a crash.

data.title: Stacks
Search is including files outside of the project
Copy Value on debug for Node JS project shortens the string
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Mac OSX Yosemite

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Debug a node project with a long string
2. In the debugger, copy the value of that string
3. The debugger shortens the string, ending it with `... (length: XX)` and that is carried over to the copied value
4. It should copy the original string value

![vscode-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3259448/15077015/613fcfce-137a-11e6-8939-a12e1ccf6358.gif)

data.title: Breakpoints Ignored and Not Triggered
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.0 - OS Version: Capitan 10.11.4 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Unlike [#5422](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/5422) my breakpoints are completely ignored. 2. I've tried running against node 4.4.3 and 5.11.1 as suggested in #5422 I've tried both launch and attaching as well as all recommended attaching steps outlined by John Papa in [SO](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/30662723/vscode-debugging-not-working-for-nodejs-application) **breakpoints set:** **In the developer tools console does list:** `waiting for debug protocol on stdin/stdout` **launch.json** `"configurations": [ { "name": "Launch", "type": "node", "request": "launch", "program": "${workspaceRoot}/build/server.js", "stopOnEntry": false, "args": [], "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}", "preLaunchTask": null, "runtimeExecutable": null, "runtimeArgs": [ "--nolazy" ], "env": { "NODE_ENV": "development" }, "externalConsole": false, "sourceMaps": true, "outDir": null },`

data.title: IntelliSense: do not steal arrow keys if there is only one suggestion showing up
data.body:
I find myself fighting over intellisense often when I am typing the variable name and then wanting to jump to the next line using arrow keys (down). The suggest widget shows me the completion for the variable I just typed and now I cannot arrow-down, I first have to dismiss the widget.

This video shows where I get stuck all the time:

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/15076679/22bb38de-13ab-11e6-80fc-e2adf5c45aa5.gif)

@alexandrudima @joaomoreno maybe in this case where you only have 1 suggestion, let me type arrow keys even if suggest is open?

data.title: Git Extension Sidebar: Resource Blocking
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Hi,

I want to post an issues about git extension performance.
I suspect git extension in the sidebar is blocking the memory that VS Code using. I experience some lag when I try to type my code.

This is occur when git refresh it status because it become laggy when loading icon appear on git sidebar, after I edit some of my code.

This is not always happening when I edit my code but very often.

Thank you

data.title: Allow reading from stdin

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
This is very useful when working with the commandline, and to pass the result directly into the editor. It's especially useful for getting a file out of git's history, eg:

``` sh
git show branch-name:path/to/file.js | code
```

FWIW, this works in Sublime & Atom.

data.title: Threads continue event
data.body:
- [x] win - PHP (isidor has a vm where PHP is setup) - **@bpasero**
- [x] linux - C++ (very easy to setup) - **@weinand**

C++ example - https://gist.github.com/edumunoz/80275bd231abb56165eb
PHP example - any simple php script, just launch it multiple times

We have changed how the continue event behaves. Have a multi-threaded program and verify step / continue / stop behave as expected. 

For PHP verify that continue only continues the selected thread, as for C++ verify that continue continues all the threads.

Also verify:
- Newly created threads are reflected in the callStack view 
- One thread resuming execution does not affect other stopped threads
- A thread that exits should disappear from the call stack view

data.title: Setting for revealing the debug console
data.body:
- [x] any platform - **@sandy081**

We have introduced a setting `internalConsoleOptions` in `launch.json` to change the behavior of automatic revealing of the debug console. Verify this setting is easy to find, use and works as expected.

It could be an user option below search settings.

data.title: Auto-escape highlighted text for search and replace regex mode
data.body:
When "Use Regular Expressions" is enabled in the search and replace window, selecting text in the editor and then bringing up search and replace through CTRL-F, CTRL-H, etc. should auto-escape the selected text to be compatible with regex matching.  

For example, when selecting a regex reserved character such as *, the find field should be populated with \* instead of * - i.e. the text you just selected should always returns matches instead of showing "No results" regardless of whether "Use Regular Expressions" is enabled or not.
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new file.
2. Bring up the search and replace and enable "Use Regular Expressions".
3. Add a regex reserved character to the blank file such as *.
4. Highlight the reserved character and bring up the search and replace again.
5. The search field is populated with the selected text, but "No results" are found and an "Invalid regular expression" error is shown instead of showing matches for the text that you just highlighted.

data.title: bug appears when open a special file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7908062/15062435/a1899e0a-1372-11e6-8787-1aed1201c3ab.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7908062/15062449/bee89b04-1372-11e6-9358-606023d9b96f.png)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a file that contains spaces, such as "reproduce bug.md".
2. In the context menu, select "Edit with code".
3. Now, you will find the filename is divided into two parts -- (reproduce, bug.md), and displays two files in splitted screen 

But, code will open file normally if I just double-click file instead of select from context menu.

data.title: Inline diff view removed lines (red) are smaller font than changed (green) lines.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version:Windows10, OS X

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set "diffEditor.renderSideBySide": false
2. Look at a git diff.

The red removed lines are smaller (Segoe WPC, SegUI 13px) while the changed lines (green) match the rest of the editor font and size.

This is poor for looking at inline diffs since the changed characters are no longer directly lined up above and below each other.

Does not repro on 1.0-stable

data.title: Inconsistent Peek Definition behavior
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Highlight or put the cursor on a variable
2. Right click > Peek Definition
3. Right click again > Peek Definition

This will close the just opened Peek window. If you use the keybinding instead (Alt + F12) to open, pressing it again does nothing. It should be consistent one way or the other.
